intro: Anotites latifolius, commonly known as the broadleaf anotites, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features broad, lance-shaped leaves that are often hairy and arranged alternately along the stem. Its flowers are typically yellow or white, forming small clusters at the ends of the branches. Anotites latifolius is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
